headline.main: Support of Foreign Paupers-Letter from Dr.Russ.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: The last report of the Ten Governors (for 1857) shows the remarkable fact that, beside tenants of our prisons and nurseries, the City of New-York administered, in a greater or less degree, to the support of 44,085 persons; that of these 44,085 persons, 36,407 were of foreign birth, and 7,688 were natives of the United States;

docs.snippet: Robert T. Haws, Comptroller elect, left tile City last evening, expecting to be absent some days. As executor of an estate, he has business in the northern part of the State, and wishing to devote all of his time to th office to which the people have...
docs.lead_paragraph: Robert T. Haws, Comptroller elect, left tile City last evening, expecting to be absent some days. As executor of an estate, he has business in the northern part of the State, and wishing to devote all of his time to th office to which the people have just elected him, he is anxious to close up all outside business before the first of January.

docs.snippet: A number of the friends of Sanitary and MORAL Improvement have been holding a series of meetings hi the Cooper Institute, to compare views and discuss the best methods of securing their ends. Over these meetings Dr. BATCHELDER, of the Academy of...
docs.lead_paragraph: A number of the friends of Sanitary and MORAL Improvement have been holding a series of meetings hi the Cooper Institute, to compare views and discuss the best methods of securing their ends. Over these meetings Dr. BATCHELDER, of the Academy of Medicine, has presided, and Dr. AGNEW has acted as Secretary.

docs.snippet: As considerable attention has been lately drawn towards the Province of Sonora, and especially to Guayamas, its principal seaport, as the proposed termination of the Pacific Railroad, perhaps a slight description of the place and its inhabitants,...
docs.lead_paragraph: As considerable attention has been lately drawn towards the Province of Sonora, and especially to Guayamas, its principal seaport, as the proposed termination of the Pacific Railroad, perhaps a slight description of the place and its inhabitants, from "one who has been there," may not be uninteresting. Guayamas is situated on an inlet of the Gulf of California, in nearly lat. 28?? north and long, 35?? west from Washington.

headline.main: THE NEW-HAVEN DIVORCE.; Application of Mrs. Mary A. Bennett for Divorce on Ground of Ill-Treatment.

docs.snippet: The Herald is exceedingly boastful over its superior " enterprise" in publishing the President's Message in advance of its neighbors. It has a perfect right to exult. Its peculiar style of enterprise was never better illustrated or more successful....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Herald is exceedingly boastful over its superior " enterprise" in publishing the President's Message in advance of its neighbors. It has a perfect right to exult. Its peculiar style of enterprise was never better illustrated or more successful. If there is any news to be obtained in the duo course of fair competition, tile Herald is always behind hand.

headline.main: THE NEW-HAVEN DIVORCE.; Application of Mrs. Mary A. Bennett for Divorce on Ground of Ill--Treatment.

docs.lead_paragraph: [A considerable portion of tile testimony in this ease is published on the Second Page of this morning's TIMES. The followed was received last night by the midnight mail.] From the New-Haven Register. WEDNESDAY MORNING, Dec. 8. Hezekiah Gorham, sworn-I reside near Dr. Bennett's George-street house.

headline.main: From the Rio de la Plata.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE BUENOS AYRES LEGISLATURE--TIIE ARGENTINE CONFEDERATION--PARAGUAY MAKING NO PREPARATIONS TO RECEIVE THE UNITED STATES SQUADRON. By the arrival at this port of the ship Parana, we have letters and papers to Oct. 23-fourteen days later than previous advices. The news is interesting, but not very important.
